title: loops
text: Code meant to replace repetitive code with a simple few lines to repeat a certain function over again

title: CSV Files
text: you can import and read CSV files in your code allowing you to add more functionality to your code. Being able to add your own CSV files into your code can help a lot in projects

title: printing
text: using the print function you can print code to do many things. You can communicate with the user as well as display information while the code is running.

title: Buttons
text: buttons can be coded into your program to allow the user to press the button to run a certain code that can do whatever you code it to do.

title: Dictionary
text: Using a dictionary is a good way to store a set of data in a group that has something in common. It allows for the data to be more organized and less time consuming to call data multiple times from different places for one thing.

title: Intro to Pandas
text: Pandas is a Python library used for data manipulation and analysis. It offers three types of data structures: Series, DataFrame, and Index objects.
code snippet:
import pandas as pd

mydataset = {
  'cars': ["Toyota", "Subaru", "Nissan"],
  'passings': [3, 7, 2]
}

myvar = pd.DataFrame(mydataset)

print(myvar)

title: Modules
text: Save code as a .py file that has the functionalities you want it to have, then use that file to import what you want in yopur code.

title: __init__
text: __init__ is used in python to initialize classes. it allows for the user to set up any initial attributes or setup tasks for later on.
